Downloads

Training Materials & Resources

Date

October 16, 2025

Overview

Download all training materials for Day 1 of the CoPhil EO AI/ML Training. All materials are provided under open licenses for educational use.

NoteDownload Package

For convenience, you can download all Day 1 materials as a single ZIP file, or download individual components below.

Complete Day 1 Package

All-in-One Download

Package Contents: - All 4 session notebooks (Jupyter .ipynb) - Presentation slides (PDF) - Cheat sheets (PDF) - Sample datasets - Session handouts

Size: ~150 MB

Download Complete Package (ZIP)

Last updated: 2025-01-15

Jupyter Notebooks

Download interactive notebooks for hands-on practice:

Session 3: Python for Geospatial Data

Day1_Session3_Python_Geospatial_Data.ipynb

Learn to work with vector data (GeoPandas) and raster data (Rasterio) in Python.

Topics Covered: - GeoPandas for vector data - Reading shapefiles, GeoJSON, and GeoPackages - Coordinate reference systems and reprojection - Rasterio for raster data - Reading GeoTIFF files - Band operations and visualization - Philippine case study: Palawan land cover

Requirements: - Google Colab (recommended) - Or local Jupyter with geopandas, rasterio installed

Download Notebook Open in Colab

Session 4: Google Earth Engine

Day1_Session4_Google_Earth_Engine.ipynb

Master Google Earth Engine for accessing and processing Copernicus data.

Topics Covered: - Earth Engine authentication and initialization - ImageCollection filtering (spatial, temporal, metadata) - Sentinel-1 SAR data access - Sentinel-2 optical data access - Cloud masking techniques - Temporal compositing - Data export workflows - Philippine case study: Metro Manila monitoring

Requirements: - Google Earth Engine account (register at earthengine.google.com) - Google Colab

Download Notebook Open in Colab

Presentation Slides

Download presentation slides for reference:

Session 1: Copernicus Sentinel Data & Philippine EO Ecosystem

Topics: - Copernicus Programme overview - Sentinel-1 SAR characteristics - Sentinel-2 optical specifications - 2025 updates (Sentinel-2C, Sentinel-1C) - Philippine EO agencies (PhilSA, NAMRIA, DOST-ASTI) - CoPhil Mirror Site introduction

Format: PDF (slides with notes)

Size: ~15 MB

Download PDF View Online

Session 2: AI/ML Fundamentals for Earth Observation

Topics: - What is AI/ML and the EO workflow - Supervised vs. Unsupervised learning - Classification and regression examples - Introduction to neural networks - Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) - Data-centric AI paradigm - EO-specific considerations

Format: PDF (slides with notes)

Size: ~12 MB

Download PDF View Online

Session 3: Python for Geospatial Data (Intro)

Topics: - Google Colab setup - Python environment for geospatial - Vector data concepts - Raster data concepts - Coordinate reference systems

Format: PDF (slides with notes)

Size: ~8 MB

Download PDF View Online

Session 4: Introduction to Google Earth Engine (Coming Soon)

Topics: - Earth Engine architecture - Python API overview - Data catalog navigation - Philippine EO applications

Format: PDF (slides with notes)

Status: In preparation

Sample Datasets

Practice datasets for offline work:

Philippine Administrative Boundaries

Description: Provincial and municipal boundaries for the Philippines

Format: GeoPackage (.gpkg)

Size: ~5 MB

Source: PhilGIS / NAMRIA

License: Open Data

Download Dataset

Contents: - Regions (17) - Provinces (81) - Municipalities and Cities - Attribute table with population data

Palawan Land Cover Sample

Description: Sentinel-2 true color composite and land cover classification

Format: GeoTIFF (.tif)

Size: ~80 MB

Area: Palawan Province subset

Date: 2024 dry season composite

Download Dataset

Files: - palawan_s2_composite.tif (RGB composite) - palawan_landcover.tif (Classification) - palawan_boundary.gpkg (Vector boundary) - README.txt (Metadata)

Metro Manila Sentinel-1 Time Series (Sample)

Description: Sentinel-1 VV/VH polarization samples

Format: GeoTIFF (.tif)

Size: ~40 MB

Area: Metro Manila subset

Dates: Monthly composites (Jan-Dec 2024)

Download Dataset

Use Cases: - Urban monitoring - Flood detection practice - Time series analysis

Code Examples Repository

Access all code examples and utilities:

GitHub Repository

Repository: copphil-training/day1-materials

Contents: - Jupyter notebooks (latest versions) - Python utility functions - Data processing scripts - Example workflows - Troubleshooting guides

Visit Repository Clone via Git

# Clone repository
git clone https://github.com/copphil-training/day1-materials.git

# Or download ZIP
wget https://github.com/copphil-training/day1-materials/archive/main.zip

Google Colab Links

Direct links to open notebooks in Google Colab:

Session 3: Python for Geospatial Data

Session 4: Google Earth Engine

TipWorking in Colab

Opening notebooks in Colab requires no local installation. All code runs in the cloud with access to GPUs and pre-installed libraries.

First Time? See the Setup Guide for authentication instructions.

Google Earth Engine: - Earth Engine Python API Guide - Earth Engine Community Tutorials - Awesome Earth Engine

AI/ML for EO: - Deep Learning for Earth Observation (Springer) - Fundamentals of Machine Learning for Predictive Data Analytics - Data-Centric AI Resource Hub

Installation Scripts

Local Python Environment Setup

For participants who want to work locally (not in Colab):

requirements.txt

numpy>=1.24.0
pandas>=2.0.0
matplotlib>=3.7.0
geopandas>=0.13.0
rasterio>=1.3.0
earthengine-api>=0.1.350
folium>=0.14.0
geemap>=0.30.0
jupyter>=1.0.0

Download requirements.txt

Installation:

# Create virtual environment
python -m venv eo-env
source eo-env/bin/activate  # On Windows: eo-env\Scripts\activate

# Install packages
pip install -r requirements.txt

# Verify installation
python -c "import geopandas; print('GeoPandas installed successfully!')"

Conda Environment (Alternative)

environment.yml

name: copphil-day1
channels:
  - conda-forge
  - defaults
dependencies:
  - python=3.10
  - numpy
  - pandas
  - matplotlib
  - geopandas
  - rasterio
  - jupyter
  - pip
  - pip:
    - earthengine-api
    - geemap

Download environment.yml

Installation:

conda env create -f environment.yml
conda activate copphil-day1
